name: SIFI's Turkish offensive taking shape
introduction: Italian ophthalmic company SIFI has announced the granting of marketing authorization in Turkey of four of its products.
content:
Italian ophthalmic company SIFI has announced the granting of marketing authorization in Turkey of four of its products.

Netira (netilmicin) is indicated for the treatment of ocular infections and is available as multi-dose and preservative-free single-dose eye drops.

Netildex (fixed combination of netilmicin and dexamethasone), meanwhile, is used in ocular inflammation of the anteriors segment of the eye, in presence or at risk of bacterial infection. It comes as multi-dose and preservative-free single-dose eye drops.

Eyestil (sodium hyaluronate) is a dry-eye treatment and is available as multi-dose and preservative-free single-dose eye drops.

Finally, Prenacid (desonide) is indicated for the treatment of ocular inflammations and is comes in eye-drops and ointment.

These products are part of a comprehensive and established ophthalmic portfolio which SIFI Ä°laç, the company’s Turkish subsidiary, expects to start distributing directly next month in Turkey, the sixth biggest pharmaceutical market in Europe.

The company is currently deploying a fully-fledged organization, including a field sales force, that will make extensive use of digital technologies to accelerate its reach to ophthalmologists and other important stakeholders in the market.

Nahide Sarisin, general manager of SIFI Ä°laç, said: “We are delighted to continue providing Turkish patients and physicians with our proven products for the effective treatment of most common ocular disorders.

“We also look forward to bring further innovations from our R&D pipeline to address unmet needs, as a sign of SIFI’s long-term commitment to Turkey.”
